resources.string: Salt is known as an ingredient you add to your food but it\’s more than that.
it is found on Earth and It\’s made of two elements: sodium Na and chloride Cl.
the scientific name for salt is sodium chloride (NaCl)
Salt is very Important to Your Body

A healthy amount of salt 
 1- helps your body to control the right amount of water and fluids that you need. 
 2- helps your heart pump blood at a healthy rate 
 3- helps your muscles and nerves function properly.

Salt is also a natural disinfectant, which means it can kill germs.\n If you have ever had a sore throat, you may have gargled with salt water to soothe and heal it \n and it can also help wounds or sores heal on your body.
Salt sounds awesome doesn\’t it? \n But what if you had too much salt?
it will cause your heart and blood to pump faster and harder to remove the extra salt that your body doesn\'t need \n This makes your blood pressure too high over time and can make you unhealthy.
Matter is The Building Blocks of the World.

Imagine that you're baking a cake. 
 you mix together the cake ingredients and then stir them together, 
 they begin to blend into a single batter, 
 and you're no longer able to pick out the original components of the recipe. 
 Why does this happen?
 It's because of how Matter works when it comes into contact with other forms of matter.
Matter can come in the form of\n a solid, liquid or gas.
All solids, liquids and gases are made of atoms\n "the Building Blocks of Matter"\n atoms are the simplest form of matter and cannot be broken down.
Atoms are extremely tiny and are unable to be seen with the human eye,\nbut they are all around us\n and even in us!
Atoms are not all the same, there are 118 different types of atoms,\n called elements. 92 Of these elements are natural\n and the rest are man-made.
Examples ot element that you might recognise are like oxygen, aluminum and iron.
Solution is when substances cannot be distinguished easily from one another.\n like mixing salt with water or baking a cake
Mixtures is a substance in which two or more substances are mixed but not chemically joined together,\\\\\\\\n that means a chemical reaction has not taken place.\\\\\\\\n like a bag of M&Ms

Biochemistry is the study of the chemistry of living things.\nBiochemists work to identify the thousands of different chemical compounds and the processesthat occur in living things.\n They seek to understand the roles these play in developing and sustaining life.
The study of biochemistry has helped people in many ways.\n Scientists have been able to detect a wide variety of diseases by studying the chemical properties of blood.
it also helped scientists understand Corona Virus (COVID-19) better
